aboutStrings.about: The tool checks your texts against the following readability tests:

It is also possible to display statistics of your text. This includes the number of sentences, words and syllables. Using an experimental feature of the tool you will be able to detect formal and most common English words in your texts and highlight them. You may also wish to save the resulting report as an RTF file. Currently, only English is supported.
In case of suggestions, bug reports and other important stuff, please feel free to contact at me@nikitakovin.ru.
The source code is available in GitHub.

credit.name: Universität Leipzig
credit.job: the list of 10000 most common English words

credit.name: Collins Cobuild Advanced Learner’s English Dictionary (2008)
credit.job: the list of English formal words

tooltips.tooltip: For Gunning Fog Score and SMOG index tests only
Don't consider words like 'Mozerov' or 'Uzbekistan' long.
Don't consider a word long, if it is in the list of the most common English words (like 'difficult').
Words with less than 3 syllables will be considered long if they are formal (like 'abstain').
Show the statistics of your text in the output (the number of sentences, words, syllables, percent of long words, etc.)
Show your text in the output
Underline words with three or more syllables in the output
Mark words people consider sophisticated, written or formal
This test rates text on a 100-point scale. The higher the score, the easier it is to understand the document. For most standard files, you want the score to be between 60 and 70.
The result is a number that corresponds with a US grade level. Your score of $score indicates that the text is expected to be understandable
even by pre-school children (from ages 3 to 6)
only by a student at college or university (ages may vary)
by an average student in $numeral grade (usually around ages $age in the United States of America).
The word is long. More than that, it is formal

statistics.statistical: Words with three or more syllables
formal words with three or more syllables

results.result: Click here to download your report in RTF.
You can also save the link below to continue experimenting with your text later.
Please remember that the link is accessible within approximately 24-48 hours and only from your computer.
It seems that you selected nothing. Go back and pick some options!

error.title: Forbidden
error.desc: You do not have permissions to view this content.

error.title: Language detection failed
error.desc: Probably, the text is too small or the language is not supported.

error.title: $language language is not supported
error.desc: We can measure readability in English texts only.

error.title: Small text
error.desc: The resulting text is still too small (less than $minwords words). Rack your brain!

error.title: Rubbish detected
error.desc: The longest English word has $longestw letters. Are you insane?

error.title: Too large
error.desc: Your text has more than $maxsymbols symbols.

error.title: Session error
error.desc: Something is wrong with the session. Probably, it is expired.

error.title: IE is forbidden
error.desc: I have discovered that you are using Internet Explorer. We do not collaborate with such people.

error.title: No database connection
error.desc: We have encountered problems while connecting to the DB:

error.title: No hacking, please
error.desc: Prevented an XSS attack through a GET variable.

prompts.prompt: Are you sure you do not want to work with this text any longer?
